events.title: Mesoamerican Long Count Calendar Epoch
events.description: The starting point (epoch) of the Mesoamerican Long Count calendar, used by the Maya civilization, traditionally correlates to August 11, 3114 BC in the Gregorian calendar.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Mesoamerican Long Count calendar, fundamental for understanding Mesoamerican chronology.

events.title: Christopher Columbus sets sail from Palos de la Frontera
events.description: Christopher Columbus departs Spain with three ships (the Niña, the Pinta, and the Santa María) on his first voyage to the New World.
events.significance: Initiated the European exploration and eventual colonization of the Americas.

events.title: British troops evacuate Boston
events.description: British forces withdraw from Boston, ending the Siege of Boston during the American Revolutionary War.
events.significance: A major strategic victory for the American colonies, boosting morale early in the war.

events.title: First Academy Awards ceremony held
events.description: The first-ever Academy Awards (Oscars) ceremony takes place in Hollywood, California, honoring outstanding achievements in filmmaking.
events.significance: Inaugurated what has become the most prestigious annual awards event in the film industry.

events.title: Jewish ghettos established by Nazis in Eastern Europe
events.description: The Nazi regime begins systematically establishing Jewish ghettos in Eastern Europe as part of the Holocaust.
events.significance: Marked a tragic escalation in the persecution of Jews during World War II.
